text: Americans sometimes say live and learn
it means learning comes through
experience and sometimes even making
mistakes I want you to keep that in mind
as we practice one of the more
challenging sounds in the English
language the R sound in this lesson
we're going to look at R and L together
in the same word so let's talk about how
R and L are different
let's take two familiar words right
light
right light let's talk about the
position of your lips right light with
are your lips are more rounded with L
your lips are more relaxed right light
now let's talk about your tongue with
the R sound the tip of your tongue comes
close to touching that heart bump behind
your upper teeth but it doesn't touch
and it holds that position the whole
time right with the L sound there is
contact with the heart bump behind your
teeth your tip of the tongue touches the
bump and then it drops down so there's
movement of the tongue as well
light light the lips and tongue are
different let's try some exercises
exercise 1 listen as I read each pair of
words and repeat after me
right light rap lap pray play Barry
belly car call fire file remember when L
is in the final position in a word there
is no dropping of the tongue the tip of
your tongue will remain pressed against
that heart bump behind your upper front
teeth so let's read these last two pairs
again car call fire file
exercise to listen and identify the
statement you hear example don't touch
the rim I said a don't touch the rim one
do you like lime I said B do you like
lime - aunt Lu called yesterday I said B
aunt Lu called yesterday three is it
curry I said a is it curry for be
careful lifting the tile I said B be
careful lifting the tile
five clarissa prayed hard I said a
clarissa prayed hard six the artist
requested more fruits I said a the
artist requested more fruits
seven Ralph released the clutch
I said be Ralph release the clutch
you
